text: Answer: (a, b, c, d) Solution: The CPU scheduler comes into play. e When process request for I/O, the CPU would get free hence the CPU scheduler could schedule next process. e When process in the CPU will finish its execution. Then the next process has to be scheduled by CPU scheduler. e When a particular process finishes its allocated time the next process from the Ready Queue is scheduled by CPU scheduler. e When the process is swapped out of the main memory, the process that is ready for execution is swapped in main memory for execution by CPU scheduler.
